name: Process Firewall
body:
### What is Process Firewall
Process Firewall is systematic solution to protect processes from resource access attacks without modifying the programs.

### How to build Process Firewall
* Install Ubuntu 12.04 (http://releases.ubuntu.com/12.04/) on your virtual machine
* Build and boot the process firewall kernel
```
$ make menuconfig
  - NOTE: could also use /boot/config-`uname -r`
$ make
$ make modules_install
$ make install
$ (boot the new kernel)
```
* Install SELinux-related stuff
```
$ apt-get install selinux 
  - NOTE: confirm that the initramfs for the pfwall kernel is regenerated.
$ reboot
$ apt-get install selinux-policy-ubuntu
```
* Install user-space tools
```
$ cd tools/pfwall
$ make install
  - the process firewall daemon pfwd that generates the log file at /var/log/pfw.log
  - information to unwind interpreters (currently, bash and php are supported)
$ reboot
  - NOTE: confirm the daemon process pfwd is running now
  - NOTE: confirm pfwall is enabled by "cat /sys/kernel/debug/pfwall_enabled"
```
* Add an example rule to log all process activities
```
$ cat /etc/pfwall/interpreter_info > /sys/kernel/debug/interpreter_info
  - this enables interpreter unrolling
$ tools/pfwall/pftables/pftables.py -h 
  - for usage
$ tools/pfwall/pftables/pftables.py -l rules/examples/log
  - file containing rules to log everything
  - NOTE: after awhile, check the pfwall log file /var/log/pfw.log
```

### Publications
1. Hayawardh Vijayakumar, Xinyang Ge, Mathias Payer, and Trent Jaeger. Jigsaw: Protecting Resource Access by Inferring Programmer Expectations, _In Proceedings of the 23rd USENIX Security Symposium (USENIX Security)_
2. Hayawardh Vijayakumar and Joshua Schiffman and Trent Jaeger, Process Firewalls: Protecting Processes During Resource Access, _In Proceedings of the 8th ACM European Conference on Computer Systems (EUROSYS 2013)_
